org.fujion.component

Class BaseUIComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fujion.component.BaseComponent
      • org.fujion.component.BaseUIComponent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDisable, IElementIdentifier, IClientTransform, IAttributeMap<String,Object>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AngularComponent, BarCode, BaseCanvasComponent, BaseInputComponent, BaseLabeledComponent, Captcha, Chart, Chart, Chart, Columns, Div, GoogleMap, Grid, Groupbox, Html, Iframe, Image, Import, Listbox, Menuseparator, MessagePane, MessageWindow, Pane, Paneview, Radiogroup, ReactComponent, Row, Rows, Slider, Span, Sparkline, SpinJS, Tabview, Toolbar, Treeview, Upload, Window

    public abstract class BaseUIComponent
extends BaseComponent
implements IDisable
    The base class from which all UI components derive.

      • addMask

        public void addMask()
        Creates a shaded mask over the component, effectively preventing direct user interaction.

      • addMask

        public void addMask(String label)
        Creates a shaded mask over the component, effectively preventing direct user interaction.
        Parameters:
        label - Text to display in the center of the mask.

      • addMask

        public void addMask(String label,
                    Popup popup)
        Creates a shaded mask over the component, effectively preventing direct user interaction.
        Parameters:
        label - Text to display in the center of the mask.
        popup - Popup to display when right-clicking on the mask.

      • removeMask

        public void removeMask()
        Removes the mask, if present.

      • getStyles

        @Component.PropertyGetter(value="style",
                          description="The active CSS styles for this component.")
public String getStyles()
        Returns the styles set for this component.
        Returns:
        The styles set for this component.

      • setStyles

        @Component.PropertySetter(value="style",
                          description="The active CSS styles for this component.")
public void setStyles(String styles)
        Sets the styles for this component, replacing any existing styles.
        Parameters:
        styles - Styles to set, represented as a string in the same format as the HTML style attribute.

      • _syncStyles

        protected void _syncStyles(String oldStyles)
        Synchronizes style properties with stored styles and with the client.
        Parameters:
        oldStyles - Previous styles value.

      • getStyle

        public String getStyle(String name)
        Returns the value of the named style.
        Parameters:
        name - The style name (e.g., "color").
        Returns:
        The value of the style, or null if no value set for the style.

      • addStyle

        public String addStyle(String name,
                       String value)
        Adds a style to existing styles. If that style already exists, it will be overwritten.
        Parameters:
        name - The style name (e.g., "color").
        value - The style value.
        Returns:
        The previous value of the style, or null if none.

      • addStyles

        public void addStyles(String styles)
        Adds styles specified as a string.
        Parameters:
        styles - Styles to add, represented as a string in the same format as the HTML style attribute.

        public String removeStyle(String name)
        Removes a style.
        Parameters:
        name - The style name (e.g., "color").
        Returns:
        The value of the removed style, or null if none.

      • setClasses

        public void setClasses(String classes)
        Sets the CSS classes for this component, replacing any existing classes.
        Parameters:
        classes - Space-delimited list of CSS classes. Extended syntax is supported (see CssClasses);

      • toggleClass

        public void toggleClass(String yesValue,
                        String noValue,
                        boolean condition)
        Toggles the presence of two mutually exclusive classes based on a condition. Extended syntax is supported for each of the class specifiers (see CssClasses)
        Parameters:
        yesValue - Classes to be added if the condition is true, or removed if false.
        noValue - Classes to be added if the condition is false, or removed if true.
        condition - The condition value.

      • setFocus

        @Component.PropertySetter(value="focus",
                          defaultValue="false",
                          defer=true,
                          description="Sets or removes focus for this component.")
public void setFocus(boolean focus)
        Sets/removes the input focus to/from this component. If the component cannot receive the input focus, the request is ignored.
        Parameters:
        focus - If true, the component receives the input focus if possible. If false and the component currently has the input focus, the focus is relinquished.

      • focus

        public void focus()
        Sets the input focus to this component. If the component cannot receive the input focus, the request is ignored. This is a shortcut for setFocus(true).

      • getCss

        @Component.PropertyGetter(value="css",
                          description="The CSS specifier for this component.")
public String getCss()
        Returns the CSS specifier for this component. This is similar to an embedded style sheet, but is associated with this component and is added to or removed from the client as this component is added or removed. Moreover, EL expressions can be used in the selector to reference this component or one of its subcomponents by their id. For example, 
              ##{id}>.inline{font-style:italic; background: white}
        Returns:
        The CSS specifier.

      • setCss

        @Component.PropertySetter(value="css",
                          description="The CSS specifier for this component.")
public void setCss(String css)
        Sets the CSS specifier for this component. This is similar to an embedded style sheet, but is associated with this component and is added to or removed from the client as this component is added or removed. Moreover, EL expressions can be used in the selector to reference this component or one of its subcomponents by their id. For example, 
              ##{id}>.inline{font-style:italic; background: white}
        Parameters:
        css - The CSS specifier.

      • reportSize

        public void reportSize()
        Causes the component to report its current dimensions and relative position via a resize event.

      • getDragid

        @Component.PropertyGetter(value="dragid",
                          description="A space-delimited list of drag id\'s associated with this component.")
public String getDragid()
        Returns a space-delimited list of drag id's associated with this component. A non-empty value enables dragging of the component. A dragged component may be dropped upon a target component whose drop id(s) matches at least one of the dragged component's drag id's. A drag id value of "*" will match any drop id.
        Returns:
        The drag id(s).

      • setDragid

        @Component.PropertySetter(value="dragid",
                          description="A space-delimited list of drag id\'s associated with this component.")
public void setDragid(String dragid)
        Sets the drag id(s) to be associated with this component.
        Parameters:
        dragid - A space-delimited list of drag id's to be associated with this component. A non-empty value enables dragging of the component. A dragged component may be dropped upon a target component whose drop id(s) matches at least one of the drag id's. A drag id value of "*" will match any drop id.

      • getDropid

        @Component.PropertyGetter(value="dropid",
                          description="A space-delimited list of drop id\'s associated with this component.")
public String getDropid()
        Returns a space-delimited list of drop id's associated with this component. A non-empty value enables this component to act as a drop target. A dragged component may be dropped upon a target component whose drop id(s) matches at least one of the dragged component's drag id's. A drop id value of "*" will match any drag id.
        Returns:
        The drag id(s).

      • setDropid

        @Component.PropertySetter(value="dropid",
                          description="A space-delimited list of drop id\'s associated with this component.")
public void setDropid(String dropid)
        Sets the drag id(s) to be associated with this component.
        Parameters:
        dropid - A space-delimited list of drop id's to be associated with this component. A non-empty value enables this component to act as a drop target. A dragged component may be dropped upon a target component whose drop id(s) matches at least one of the dragged component's drag id's. A drop id value of "*" will match any drag id.

      • afterRemoveChild

        protected void afterRemoveChild(BaseComponent child)
        If the child being removed is the popup, set the popup to null.
        Overrides:
        afterRemoveChild in class BaseComponent
        Parameters:
        child - The removed child.
        See Also:
        BaseComponent.afterRemoveChild(org.fujion.component.BaseComponent)

      • getKeycapture

        @Component.PropertyGetter(value="keycapture",
                          description="The list of key codes to be captured.")
public String getKeycapture()
        Returns the list of key codes to be captured. When a key in this list is typed, a "keycapture" event will be sent to this component.
        Returns:
        List of key codes to be captured (see KeyCode.normalizeKeyCapture(java.lang.String) for formatting details).

      • setKeycapture

        @Component.PropertySetter(value="keycapture",
                          description="The list of key codes to be captured.")
public void setKeycapture(String keycapture)
        Sets the list of key codes to be captured. When a key in this list is typed, a "keycapture" event will be sent to this component.
        Parameters:
        keycapture - List of key codes to be captured (see KeyCode.normalizeKeyCapture(java.lang.String) for formatting details).

      • scrollIntoView

        public void scrollIntoView()
        Ensures that this component is visible within the view port by scrolling if necessary.

      • getFirstVisibleChild

        public BaseUIComponent getFirstVisibleChild(boolean recurse)
        Returns the first visible child, if any.
        Parameters:
        recurse - If true, all descendant levels are also searched using a breadth first strategy.
        Returns:
        The first visible child encountered, or null if not found.

      • getFirstVisibleChild

        public <T extends BaseUIComponent> T getFirstVisibleChild(Class<T> clazz,
                                                          boolean recurse)
        Returns the first visible child of a given class, if any.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The child class.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The child class to consider.
        recurse - If true, all descendant levels are also searched using a breadth first strategy.
        Returns:
        The first visible child encountered, or null if not found.
